p: Although there were data that enabled us to propose that differences in the growth of A.Â butcheri among estuaries were not strongly related to either water temperature (with air temperature as a surrogate) or salinity, there are no data to facilitate comparisons of the oxygen regimes across those estuaries. When available, oxygen concentration in those estuaries was based on measurements taken on a single day during sampling and often at seasonal intervals and thus do not provide a reliable basis for comparing oxygen concentrations among those estuaries.
